comment: Nice guy but lectures are a bit boring. Tests are not too hard because he gives a study guide. The great thing is that he curves exam grades and is very willing to help you succeed.

Useless professor. Seems interested in the material towards the beginning of the semester but falls behind a week later. Seems more interested in his jazz career and ga tech students than his ksu students.

Worst teacher i've had since attending KSU. Gets distracted VERY easily & takes forever to grade assignments. Unclear about what you will be tested on and is confusing. He says one thing in class while the book says  another, making it hard to understand what is right and wrong. If he doesn't know the answer to a ?, he ignores you. Not Recommended.

Professor Brooks is a good teacher just distracted. Four tests graded on a curve and a few other simple assignments but it takes FOREVER for him to grade stuff and post the grades. Heâ??s a cool guy and a good professor. I would recommend him only if you donâ??t mind not knowing your scores right away, but it was a pretty easy class.

great professor!! a little boring at times, as it's mostly lectures from powerpoints. he gives study guides which are quite useful for the tests!! mostly focused on the vocab terms and the information in the book regarding it. don't just study the powerpoints! i did okay(1 C & 3 B's) on the tests and managed to pass with an A!

Take him if you can! He is a great professor. Test are easy with a study guide. says attendance is mandatory but hardly takes roll. a few very small online projects but they are very easy and short. gives extra credit.

Cool guy, but he reads straight from the powerpoints and doesn't really make the material interesting or relevant. Ignores you if you raise your hand. He said attendance is mandatory, but has only taken it 3 times since August. Tests come straight from PPs, which are posted on Vista, and he gives a study guide. Easy class is you just do the work.

I have not purchased the textbook for this class. Almost everything on the tests are on his power points. He rarely takes attendance, curves his tests, gives extra credit, you dont need a textbook, and there are no papers. I had no interests in this subject matter prior to the class but now I think it is really interesting and I have learned a lot.
It is good information but if you want to do well stick to the text. He doesn't know as much as he pretends to and consistantly gives incorrect information in his lectures. Don't study from notes!

I'm not sure if it's because he's working on his PhD right now, but he's ALWAYS late to class and most of the time doesn't know what the heck he's talking about. Classmates prove him wrong all of the time, and he ignores when people have their hands up for questions, I'm assuming since most of the time he can't answer them. A very irritating man.
He is an awesome professor. His lectures are fun and get the whole class talking. He gives very good powerpoint notes that are available online and takes his tests right from those notes.

Prof. is a nice guy and loves what he does, but he clearly doesn't have enough experience yet. Go to class because you need to hear the lectures and you don't want to miss the group work. His tests have some hard questions on them, but he does curve them. Knowing the definitions is not enough. He gives plenty of opportunities for extra credit.
Awesome teacher and a great guy!! Really loves the subjest. Gives a ton of extra credit, but the class is pretty easy overall if you pay attention. Great professor and would recommend taking!
Really cool guy and teacher!!!! Really loves the subject and has so many extra credit opportunities that's it's impossible to fail if you try. I would take him again in a heartbeat!

Tests are kind of difficult, but he gives a ton of extra credit and usually curves the tests. Drops the lowest test grade too. Attendance was mandatory, but he never took role. You have two free days you can miss as well. Very nice guy and the class was easy. Leaving with a very high A.
